title: Joyful Worship in Jerusalem
shortSummary: Psalm 122 is a song of pilgrimage expressing joy and anticipation for worship in Jerusalem, the city of God’s presence and justice. It highlights the unity of Israel’s tribes, the importance of peace in the city, and a prayer for Jerusalem’s prosperity because of the Lord’s dwelling there.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - Reign of King David

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: The author of this psalm, King David, expresses his gladness and reverence for Jerusalem as the spiritual center of Israel.

keyCharacters.name: The Tribes of Israel
keyCharacters.description: The twelve tribes who journey to Jerusalem to worship and give thanks to the Lord, symbolizing national unity.

definitions.definition: A type of psalm sung by pilgrims ascending to Jerusalem, often associated with the steps leading to the temple.
Seats of authority where justice was administered, here referring to the Davidic monarchy’s role in governing Israel.
The covenant witness or law given to Israel, which the tribes come to honor and uphold.
A prayer for shalom—completeness, welfare, and tranquility—within the city that houses God’s temple.

outline.heading: Joyful Anticipation of Worship
outline.description: David expresses his gladness at the invitation to go to the house of the Lord and stands within Jerusalem’s gates, symbolizing the pilgrim’s joyful approach to worship.

outline.heading: Jerusalem’s Unity and Purpose
outline.description: The psalm describes Jerusalem as a well-built, compact city where the tribes of Israel gather to give thanks and where the Davidic thrones of judgment are established, emphasizing the city’s spiritual and judicial significance.

outline.heading: Prayer for Peace and Prosperity
outline.description: David prays earnestly for peace within Jerusalem’s walls and prosperity for its inhabitants, motivated by love for his brethren and reverence for the house of the Lord.

application: Cultivate a heart of gladness and eagerness to gather with God’s people for worship, recognizing the privilege of approaching His presence.
Pray consistently for the peace and prosperity of the church and community, understanding that spiritual well-being impacts all aspects of life.
Value unity within the body of Christ, just as the tribes of Israel united in Jerusalem, and seek to encourage fellowship among believers.
Recognize the importance of godly leadership and justice, praying for those who govern according to God’s standards.

keyVerses.text: I was glad when they said unto me, Let us go into the house of the LORD.
keyVerses.significance: This verse captures the joyful anticipation of worship and fellowship with God, setting the tone for the entire psalm.

keyVerses.text: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem: they shall prosper that love thee.
keyVerses.significance: It emphasizes the believer’s responsibility to pray for peace and the promise of prosperity for those who love God’s city.

keyVerses.text: Because of the house of the LORD our God I will seek thy good.
keyVerses.significance: This verse reveals the motivation behind praying and working for Jerusalem’s welfare—God’s presence and glory in the city.
